Changed the RichText.text set method to short-circuit if _text == value (as in TextBase and RichEditableText) and if the value of _text was most recently set by explicitly setting the text property.
Transferred from the Adobe Open Source Subversion Repository

RichText needs to recompose if the contentHeight isn't the same as the unscaledHeight since the content height could be an estimated height which doesn't all the text lines composed yet to back up that height.

baselinePosition should always return a non-0 value, even if there are no text lines so that components that use the baseline for positioning, such as ButtonBar, don't jump around when the width of the component is changed.
Tests run: checkintests, cyclone on Label, RichText
Transferred from the Adobe Open Source Subversion Repository
Pre-FP10.1, set default tab stops in TLF.  Without this, if there is a tab and TLF is measuring width, the tab will measure as the rest of the remaining width up to 10000.
Transferred from the Adobe Open Source Subversion Repository
SDK-24646 - Masking element on RIchText should inherit the target group's coordinate space
SDK-24559 - Using a mask with RichText doesn't work if you are using an MX Application
Fixed masking in RichText. The mask was not properly parented. Since we don't need to fake the parenting chain, we pass a null parent to MaskUtil.applyMask
Removed mask.parent check from MaskUtil.applyMask. It doesn't need this check.
Restored the mask initialization order in GraphicElement. Moved the addChild call back before the MaskUtil.applyMatirx call.
Transferred from the Adobe Open Source Subversion Repository

Because TLF does not have the concept of "auto" fontLookup like we have at the Flex-level, we have had to rework the meaning of the fontLookup attribute so it is possible to have spans with device text in a component whose fontLookup is "embeddedCFF" without requiring fontLookup "device" to be explicitly specified for those spans.
For Spark text components, the default fontLookup has been changed from "auto" to "embeddedCFF".  The default fontFamily is "Arial".

If the component level fontLookup either defaults to "embeddedCFF" or is explicitly set to "embeddedCFF", for each element that is not explicitly set to fontLookup "device", it will first look for the embedded font, and failing that, will fail back to the device font.  All fonts for a given text component must be in the same swf context.
If the component-level fontLookup is "device" or the component-level fontFamily is not found in the swf context, the font lookup for all elements in the component will revert to "device".
If the player doesn't find the device font it will fallback to one of the builtin default fonts.
QE notes: probably need some new mustella tests to cover all the cases - 5 RichText truncation tests fail but I'm not sure this change has anything to do with that
Tests run: checkintests, TextArea, Label, RichText
